task.name: hifv_flagdata
task.shortdescription: Do basic deterministic flagging of a list of MeasurementSets
task.description:
The hifv_flagdata task performs basic flagging operations on a list of MeasurementSets.
The hifv_flagdata task performs basic flagging operations on a list of measurements including:
o autocorrelation data flagging o shadowed antenna data flagging o scan based flagging o edge channel flagging o baseband edge flagging o applying online flags o applying a flagging template o quack, shadow, and basebands o Antenna not-on-source (ANOS)

param.name: vis
param.description: List of visibility data files. These may be ASDMs, tar files of ASDMs, MSes, or tar files of MSes, If ASDM files are specified, they will be converted to MS format. example: vis=['X227.ms', 'asdms.tar.gz']

param.name: autocorr
param.description: Flag autocorrelation data

param.name: shadow
param.description: Flag shadowed antennas

param.name: scan
param.description: Flag specified scans

param.name: scannumber
param.shortdescription: List of scans to be flagged
param.description: A string containing a comma delimited list of scans to be flagged. example: '3,5,6'

param.name: quack
param.description: Quack scans

param.name: clip
param.description: Clip mode

param.name: baseband
param.shortdescription: Flag 20MHz of each edge of basebands
param.description: Flag 20MHz of each edge of basebands

param.name: intents
param.shortdescription: List of intents of scans to be flagged
param.description: A string containing a comma delimited list of intents against which the scans to be flagged are matched. example: '*BANDPASS*'

param.name: edgespw
param.description: Fraction of the baseline correlator TDM edge channels to be flagged.

param.name: fracspw
param.shortdescription: Fraction of baseline correlator edge channels to be flagged
param.description: Fraction of baseline correlator edge channels to be flagged

param.name: online
param.description: Apply the online flags

param.name: fileonline
param.shortdescription: File of online flags to be applied
param.description: File containing the online flags. These are computed by the h_init or hif_importdata data tasks. If the online flags files are undefined a name of the form 'msname.flagonline.txt' is assumed.

param.name: template
param.description: Apply a flagging template

param.name: filetemplate
param.shortdescription: File that contains the flagging template
param.description: The name of a text file that contains the flagging template for RFI, birdies, telluric lines, etc. If the template flags files is undefined a name of the form 'msname.flagtemplate.txt' is assumed.

param.name: hm_tbuff
param.description: The time buffer computation heuristic

param.name: tbuff
param.shortdescription: List of time buffers (sec) to pad timerange in flag commands
param.description: List of time buffers (sec) to pad timerange in flag commands

param.name: pipelinemode
param.description: The pipeline operating mode. In 'automatic' mode the pipeline determines the values of all context defined pipeline inputs automatically. In interactive mode the user can set the pipeline context defined parameters manually. In 'getinputs' mode the user can check the settings of all pipeline parameters without running the task.

param.name: flagbackup
param.shortdescription: Backup pre-existing flags before applying new ones. Only can be set in pipelinemode=\'interactive\'.
param.description: Backup pre-existing flags before applying new ones. Only can be set in pipelinemode='interactive'.

param.name: dryrun
param.shortdescription: Run the task (False) or display task command (True)
param.description: Run the commands (True) or generate the commands to be run but do not execute (False). This is a pipeline task execution mode.

param.name: acceptresults
param.shortdescription: Add the results into the pipeline context
param.description: Add the results of the task to the pipeline context (True) or reject them (False). This is a pipeline task execution mode.

task.example:
Output:
results -- If pipeline mode is 'getinputs' then None is returned. Otherwise the results object for the pipeline task is returned.
Examples
1. Do basic flagging on a MeasurementSet
hifv_flagdata()
2. Do basic flagging on a MeasurementSet as well as flag pointing and atmosphere data
hifv_flagdata(scan=True intent='*BANDPASS*')
